title: TikTok Influencer Arrested After Flaunting $500 Shoplifting Haul Online
content: Velez, who has more than 300,000 followers on TikTok, is accused of stealing 16 items, including household goods and clothing, valued at $500.32
summary: Velez, who has more than 300,000 followers on TikTok, is accused of stealing 16 items, including household goods and clothing, valued at $500.32

title: Google, Meta Asks Australia To Delay Social Media Ban For Children
content: Google and Facebook-owner Meta Platforms urged the Australian government on Tuesday to delay a bill that will ban most forms of social media for children under 16, saying more time was needed to assess its potential impact.
summary: Google and Facebook-owner Meta Platforms urged the Australian government on Tuesday to delay a bill that will ban most forms of social media for children under 16, saying more time was needed to assess its potential impact.

title: Japan Space Agency Halts Epsilon S Rocket Launch Due To Massive Fire At Site
content: A major fire erupted Tuesday at a Japan space agency site as it tested a solid-fuel Epsilon S rocket, television footage showed.
summary: A major fire erupted Tuesday at a Japan space agency site as it tested a solid-fuel Epsilon S rocket, television footage showed.

title: Passengers Duct-Tape Unruly Man Who Tried To Open Door Mid-Flight
content: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) as well as the Federal Bureau of Investigation (GBI) have started their probe into the incident.
summary: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) as well as the Federal Bureau of Investigation (GBI) have started their probe into the incident.

title: After 3,700 Deaths, A Year Of War, Israel-Hezbollah Truce Deal Likely Today
content: The Israel Cabinet is set to vote on a ceasefire deal with Lebanon on Tuesday after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu reportedly gave his "in principle" approval to the plan after a security consultation with Israeli officials.
summary: The Israel Cabinet is set to vote on a ceasefire deal with Lebanon on Tuesday after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu reportedly gave his "in principle" approval to the plan after a security consultation with Israeli officials.

title: Why US Presidents Pardon Turkeys On Thanksgiving Day? History And Significance
content: The tradition of pardoning the turkeys reportedly began during the Civil War when president Abraham Lincoln's son requested him to spare a turkey.
summary: The tradition of pardoning the turkeys reportedly began during the Civil War when president Abraham Lincoln's son requested him to spare a turkey.

title: "On January 20...": Donald Trump Vows Big Tariffs On China, Canada, Mexico
content: Donald Trump vowed Monday to impose a 25 percent tariff on all imports from Mexico and Canada as one of his first actions upon becoming US president in January.
summary: Donald Trump vowed Monday to impose a 25 percent tariff on all imports from Mexico and Canada as one of his first actions upon becoming US president in January.

title: Ukraine's Kyiv Under Multi-Wave Russian Drone Attacks, Claims Mayor
content: Ukraine's capital of Kyiv is under a sustained Russian drone attack, Mayor Vitali Klitschko said early on Tuesday.
summary: Ukraine's capital of Kyiv is under a sustained Russian drone attack, Mayor Vitali Klitschko said early on Tuesday.

title: 31 Killed In 1 Day After Israeli Strikes, Says Lebanon
content: Israeli strikes pummelled south Beirut on Monday, Lebanese official media said, and health authorities reported 31 people killed across the war-hit country, most of them in the south.
summary: Israeli strikes pummelled south Beirut on Monday, Lebanese official media said, and health authorities reported 31 people killed across the war-hit country, most of them in the south.

title: "Commitment To...": Biden To Attend Trump's Inauguration, Says White House
content: US President Joe Biden will attend Donald Trump's inauguration in January, the White House said Monday, calling it a "commitment to our democratic values" despite Trump skipping Biden's own swearing-in.
summary: US President Joe Biden will attend Donald Trump's inauguration in January, the White House said Monday, calling it a "commitment to our democratic values" despite Trump skipping Biden's own swearing-in.

title: US Judge Dismisses 2020 Election Case Against Donald Trump
content: A judge on Monday granted a request by prosecutors to dismiss the election subversion case against Donald Trump because of a Justice Department policy of not prosecuting a sitting president.
summary: A judge on Monday granted a request by prosecutors to dismiss the election subversion case against Donald Trump because of a Justice Department policy of not prosecuting a sitting president.

title: Dictionary.com's Word Of The Year Chosen Mindfully, Here's What It Is
content: The word is a part of a phrase that became a viral sensation in August. It was brought into vogue by TikToker Jools Lebron whose phrase "very demure, very mindful" whose series of videos were later replicated by other influencers and creators.
summary: The word is a part of a phrase that became a viral sensation in August. It was brought into vogue by TikToker Jools Lebron whose phrase "very demure, very mindful" whose series of videos were later replicated by other influencers and creators.

title: Elon Musk Calls For US To Replace Fighter Jets With Drones
content: Billionaire Elon Musk, tapped by US President-elect Donald Trump to slash federal government spending, lashed out at modern fighter jets on Monday, saying that drones were the future of air combat.
summary: Billionaire Elon Musk, tapped by US President-elect Donald Trump to slash federal government spending, lashed out at modern fighter jets on Monday, saying that drones were the future of air combat.

title: Ceasefire Deal Between Israel-Hezbollah "Close", Says White House
content: The United States believes a ceasefire deal between Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah is "close" but negotiations are still ongoing, the White House said on Monday.
summary: The United States believes a ceasefire deal between Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah is "close" but negotiations are still ongoing, the White House said on Monday.

title: Karachi Sees Surge In Street Crimes, 45,000 Incidents Reported This Year
content: Most people in Karachi feel unsafe as the rate of violent crime has soared in the metropolitan city of nearly 20 million population, said Bashir Babu, a factory worker who has been a mugging victim twice.
summary: Most people in Karachi feel unsafe as the rate of violent crime has soared in the metropolitan city of nearly 20 million population, said Bashir Babu, a factory worker who has been a mugging victim twice.

title: "MP Has Immense Potential": Chief Minister On UK Visit To Seek Investments
content: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav is on a week-long visit to the United Kingdom (UK) and Germany from November 24 to November 30 to attract investment to the state.
summary: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav is on a week-long visit to the United Kingdom (UK) and Germany from November 24 to November 30 to attract investment to the state.

title: "India Condemns Hostage-Taking, Terror": S Jaishankar On Israel-Hamas War
content: India supports an immediate ceasefire in West Asia and favours a two-state solution in the long-term, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Monday as he condemned terrorism, hostage-taking and civilian casualties in military operations.
summary: India supports an immediate ceasefire in West Asia and favours a two-state solution in the long-term, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Monday as he condemned terrorism, hostage-taking and civilian casualties in military operations.

title: Deadliest Place For Women Is Home: UN Report
content: The deadliest place for women is at home because a staggering 140 women and girls are killed every day by an intimate partner or family member.
summary: The deadliest place for women is at home because a staggering 140 women and girls are killed every day by an intimate partner or family member.

title: Indian Charged For Sexually Harassing 4 Women On Singapore Airlines Flight
content: A 73-year-old Indian national was charged in a Singapore court on Monday for allegedly molesting four women while on board a Singapore Airlines (SIA) flight from the United States to Singapore.
summary: A 73-year-old Indian national was charged in a Singapore court on Monday for allegedly molesting four women while on board a Singapore Airlines (SIA) flight from the United States to Singapore.

title: France Unveils Measures To Fight Violence Against Women
content: Since the start of this year, 122 women have been killed, according to the feminist group NousToutes.
summary: Since the start of this year, 122 women have been killed, according to the feminist group NousToutes.
